page.title: 07Education in the area
page.content: To the West of the River Trent, in {Nottinghamshire},Education takes place at{Misterton County Primary School} which serves the villages of Misterton and West Stockwith; to the East in{ {Lincolnshire}there is no school in the small villages and children are taken by bus to the nearest school at{Morton part of{Gainsborough} After the age of eleven,the Nottinghamshire children transfer to{ {The Ordsall Hall School},a comprehensive school about eleven miles away in{Retford}to which they are taken by special bus.At the same age Lincolnshire children go to schools in Gainsborough. In 1972, Misterton Primary School celebrated its centenary (originally a 'Board School') but has since transferred to remodelled buildings formerly occupied by Secondary pupils.
